abstract.p: Prime Min Stephen Harper lures Wajid Khan, Liberal member of Canada's Parliament to his Conservative caucus, improving odds that his minority government will survive attempts by opposition parties to force election (S)

block.p: Prime Minister Stephen Harper lured a Liberal member of Parliament to his Conservative caucus, improving odds that his minority government will survive attempts by opposition parties to force an election. The lawmaker, Wajid Khan of Toronto, a former pilot in the Pakistani Air Force, said he had defected partly because he had to choose between staying a Liberal and continuing as a special adviser to Mr. Harper on South Asia and the Middle East. The Conservatives control 125 seats in the 308-seat House of Commons, and can now win votes with the support of any one of three opposition parties.
